meanings.definition: The quality or state of being full of energy and life.
meanings.sent1: The garden was filled with the vibrance of blooming flowers.
meanings.sent2: The children's laughter added vibrance to the playground.
meanings.sent3: The party had so much vibrance that even the shyest guest couldn't resist dancing.
meanings.sent4: Her smile brought a vibrance to the room that was infectious.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors and lively music created a scene of pure vibrance.

meanings.definition: The brightness or intensity of color.
meanings.sent1: The vibrance of the sunset painted the sky in shades of orange and pink.
meanings.sent2: The artist used various shades to enhance the vibrance of the painting.
meanings.sent3: The vibrance of the neon sign made it impossible to miss in the dark alley.
meanings.sent4: The vibrance of her dress outshone all others at the party.
meanings.sent5: The vibrance of the flowers in the garden made it a colorful paradise.
